info.title: The Orchestrator
info.description: The orchestrator is a project that enables users to run workflows.

post.summary: Update Progress On Awaiting Process Endpoint

put.description:
Retry all task processes in status Failed, Waiting, API Unavailable or Inconsistent Data.

The retry is started in the background, returning status 200 and number of processes in message.
When it is already running, refuse and return status 409 instead.

get.description: Retrieve status counts for processes and tasks.

schema.title: Response Processes Filterable Api Processes  Get

schema.title: Response Log Error Api User Error Post

post.description:
Log frontend messages that are related to user actions.

When the frontend finalizes the setup of a login session it will do a HTTP POST to this endpoint. The frontend
will also post to this endpoint when it ends a user session.

Args:
    user_name: the username (email) of the user involved
    message: A log message.

Returns:
    {}

schema.title: Response Log User Info Api User Log  User Name  Post

get.description:
Return data on job workers and queues.

Returns:
- The number of queued jobs
- The number of workers
- The number of running jobs
- The number of successful and unsuccessful jobs

get.summary: Get Node By Ims Node Name
get.description:
Return only one node by node name.

Args:
    ims_node_name: str eg ah001a-jnx-testrobot35-vtb

Returns: the node dictionary

get.summary: Get Node By Ims Node Id
get.description:
Return only one node by node id.

Args:
    ims_node_id: The IMS node id

Returns: the node dictionary

Find the nodes with status "planned" and "ready for service" on a given location.

Args:
    location_code: As used in IMS (e.g. UT001A)

Returns: list with nodes. Fields are copied one on one from the swagger definitions

schema.title: Response Nodes Api Surf Ims Nodes  Location Code  Get

get.summary: Get Nodes By Location And Status
get.description:
Find the nodes at a location by status.

Args:
    location_code: As used in IMS (e.g UT001A)
    status: status of the node as used in IMS (PL, RFS, IS, RFC, OOS)

Query params:
    unsubscribed_only: if True, return only nodes without subscription, otherwise return all nodes

Returns: List of nodes

schema.title: Response Get Nodes By Location And Status Api Surf Ims Nodes  Location Code   Status  Get

get.description:
Calculate the free/non-allocated blocks for a given prefix. Give back largest possible chunks.

:param network_address: the network_address of the parent under which free space is returned.
:param prefixlen: the prefix length of the parent under which the free space is returned.
:return:

schema.title: Response Free Subnets Api Surf Ipam Free Subnets  Network Address   Prefixlen  Get

get.description:
Calculate the free/non-allocated blocks for a given prefix. Give back chunks of size preflenx.

:param prefix: the network_address of the parent under which free space is returned.
:param netmask: the prefix length of the parent under which free space is returned.
:param prefixlen: the size of the returned free/non-allocated subprefixes.
:return:

schema.title: Response Free Subnets Split Api Surf Ipam Free Subnets  Prefix   Netmask   Prefixlen  Get

Response Port Subscriptions Filterable Api Surf Subscriptions Ports Get

get.description:
Retrieve an NSI LightPath SurfSubscriptionTable ID for OpenNSA.

This is a custom endpoint in the orchestrator to support the OpenNSA deployment. It is necessary to be compatible
with OpenNSA. The OpenNSA only has a notion of interfaces and vlans, not of deployed LightPaths. It searches for
deployed LightPaths with the port and vlan combination.

Args:
    port_subscription_id_1: PortSchema one
    vlan_1: vlan 1
    port_subscription_id_2: PortSchema 2
    vlan_2: vlan 2

Returns:
---
    {"subscription_id": UUID}

Return a list of subscriptions with detected depends on subscriptions.

This implementation is necessary for the Network dashboard.

Args:
    customer_id: Customer id

Returns:
---
    list of Subscriptions

    customer_id: customer id

Returns:
---
    list of Subscriptions.

get.description:
Get the health status of the mailer service.

This endpoint attempts to send an e-mail via the mailer service, checking
for that e-mail's arrival as well.

Raises:
    HTTPException: In case sending fails or receiving the health check
        e-mail fails (code = 503).

Returns:
    MailBody: The e-mail's content, including its unique id.

get.description:
Retrieve subscriptions that are in use by this subscription.

Args:
    subscription_id: Subscription to query
    filter_statuses: List of filters
    recurse_product_types: which products to nest inside.
    recurse_depth_limit: Allow nested subscriptions with a depth limit.
      - example: SP that has a MSC which also has connected subscriptions.

Returns:
    list of subscriptions

schema.title: Response In Use By Subscriptions Api Pythia Legacy Subscriptions In Use By  Subscription Id  Get

ActionType.title: ActionType
ActionType.description: Defines the explicit, safe actions the agent can request.

DateRangeFilter.title: DateRangeFilter
DateRangeFilter.description: A filter that operates on a range of dates.

DateValueFilter.title: DateValueFilter
DateValueFilter.description: A filter that operates on a single date value.

op.description: Operator for grouping conditions in uppercase.

FilterTree.title: FilterTree
FilterTree.description:
Boolean filter tree. Operators must be UPPERCASE: AND / OR.
Node shapes:
   Group: {'op':'AND'|'OR', 'children': [<PathFilter|FilterTree>, ...]}
   Leaf (PathFilter): {'path':'<ltree>', 'condition': {...}}
Rules:
   Do NOT put 'op' or 'children' inside a leaf 'condition'.
   Max depth = 5.

HealthMailBody.title: HealthMailBody
HealthMailBody.description: Email contents suitable for an E2E test.

value.title: Value
value.description: The ltree path or lquery pattern to compare against.

MatchingField.title: MatchingField
MatchingField.description: Contains the field that contributed most to the (fuzzy) search result.

NumericRangeFilter.title: NumericRangeFilter
NumericRangeFilter.description: A filter for a range of numeric values (int or float).

NumericValueFilter.title: NumericValueFilter
NumericValueFilter.description: A filter for single numeric value comparisons (int or float).

path.title: Path
path.description: The ltree path of the field to filter on, e.g., 'subscription.customer_id'.

entity_type.description: The type of entity to search.

filters.description: A list of structured filters to apply to the search.

query.title: Query

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of search results to return.
